docTitle.titlePart:
Carbon Dioxide and Dissolved
Oxygen Removal From Makeup
Water By Gas Transfer
Membranes

front.div:
Summary
New membrane processes for water treatment are
continually being sought after for their simple and
continuous operation. A new approach for remov-
ing dissolved gases from make-up supplies utilizes
hydrophobic hollow fiber membranes. These mem-
branes have many characteristics that enhance
or replace other degassing methods. This paper
reports carbon dioxide and dissolved oxygen
removal efficiencies for a 100 gpm gas transfer
membrane unit installed in a nuclear power plant's
make-up system.
